input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to make white mayonnaise?
input_text.Response A:
I think so. But I would need a little more information about the ingredients you have on hand and the equipment you have available.

For example, do you have a blender or food processor? If so, you can use it to make the mayonnaise. If not, you can make it by hand, but it will take a little more time and effort.

Also, what kind of oil do you have? You will need an oil that is liquid at room temperature, such as olive oil, canola oil, or sunflower oil.

Once you have the ingredients and equipment ready, you can follow these steps:

1. In a blender or food processor, combine 1 egg yolk, 1/4 cup oil, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and a pinch of salt.
2. Blend or process until the mixture is thick and creamy.
3. Add more oil, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the mixture is the desired consistency.
4. Blend or process until the mixture is smooth and well-combined.
5. Transfer the mayonnaise to a bowl and stir in 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice and a pinch of salt.
6. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

I hope this helps. Let me know if you have any other questions.
input_text.Response B: Sure, although you may not know this, mayonnaise is an emulsification of fat into water, with some additional ingredients to enhance flavor and texture.  In general, emulsification can be performed using various techniques, but the most common method for home cooks is to use an immersion blender, which is also known as a stick blender.  The process involves combining ingredients in a mixing bowl, and then using the blender to incorporate air into the mixture, which will enable the fat and water to remain evenly mixed.  Air can also be incorporated by hand, using a whisk, but this is more time consuming and less effective.  The ingredients typically used for mayonnaise are eggs, oil, vinegar, and various seasonings.  For a white mayonnaise, you would typically use a white vinegar, such as white wine vinegar or white vinegar made from distilled vinegar and water, and you would leave out any ingredients that would add color, such as mustard or paprika, which are often included in yellow mayonnaise.

input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to serve at a dinner party?

- Thank your guests for coming.

3. Fill the plates: Use a spoon or tongs to put the food on the plates. Make sure to fill each plate with a little bit of everything.

5. Keep the glasses full: Keep the glasses full of water or other drinks. If someone needs a refill, fill their glass up again.
6. Clean up: After everyone is done eating, clean up the table by taking away the plates and glasses. Make sure to throw away any trash.

Remember, serving at a dinner party is all about being helpful and making sure everyone has what they need. Just follow these simple steps and you'll do great!

The opening ceremony of the new plant was attended by 150 dignitaries, including Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, Samsung SDI President Jun Young-hyun, Hungarian Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade Peter Szijjarto and Korean Ambassador to Hungary Yim Geun-hyeong.

Samsung SDI earlier used this plant to make plasma display panels (PDP) plant. The plant has now been transformed into one that is equipped with technology to produce high-power and high-efficiency EV batteries. The Hungary plant is the third such plant that Samsung SDI now has for the production of EV batteries, in addition to plants in Ulsan, South Korea and Xian, China.

In January this year, the company had debuted its new battery that has the capacity to deliver driving range of up to 600 km and could fast charge an EV in 20 minutes with a driving range of 500 km.

input_text.Prompt:
Under Armour has officially unveiled the successor to its SpeedForm Gemini 2 RE smart running shoe with three new styles to choose from and more data now on offer for runners.

The UA SpeedForm Gemini 3 RE ($160), Velociti RE ($140) and Europa RE ($160) range pack in the same sensors as the Gemini 2 shoe to offer automatic run tracking and the ability to record data including cadence, real-time pace as well as storing the mileage lifetime of the shoe.

Essential reading: How connected footwear will invade your life

All of that data is stored in the iOS and Android-friendly MapMyRun app, which is integrated with Under Armour's Record app that pulls in data from other UA wearables including the UA Band and UA Heart Rate chest strap.

UA SpeedForm Gemini 3 RE

Along with some basic running stats, Under Armour is also adding a new Jump Test feature that scientifically measures muscular fatigue level to help you decide whether you should be putting in a big 10 miler. It works by measuring the average air time of a sequence of jumps. It should help users track recovery status over time and provide guidance on how to alter the intensity of a workout.

UA SpeedForm Europa RE

The new collection aims to cater for a wider range of runners, whether you're all about endurance or you prefer to pick up the pace. The Gemini 3 features a knit midfoot panel for added support and charged cushioning for improved responsiveness. The Europa is a more lightweight option with a mesh tongue and toe box for a more snug fit and increased ventilation. The Velocity is another lightweight shoe that includes an embedded sock liner for increased support and charged cushioning for an extra layer of durability. Like the Gemini 2, you don't need to charge any of these connected shoes.

The new UA SpeedForm range is going to be available to pre-order from the UA.com website from 5 January, which will include an annual subscription to MapMyRun. They're all going to be on show at CES 2017, which kicks off in January and we'll be there to take a closer look at them.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: Under Armour has released the successor to its SpeedForm Gemini 2 RE smart running shoe, with the new UA SpeedForm Gemini 3 RE, Velociti RE and Europa RE models featuring sensors that offer automatic run tracking and record data including cadence, real-time pace and lifetime shoe mileage. The new shoes will be available to pre-order from 5 January and will include an annual subscription to MapMyRun.
input_text.Response B: After its own poll found that 80% of New Yorkers support Uber, the ride-sharing giant has launched a multi-million dollar ad campaign in the city to fight back against Mayor Bill de Blasio's proposed cap on its operations. The ads, which will appear in print, radio, TV and online, are designed to counter claims that Uber's growth is threatening the livelihoods of yellow taxi drivers. The ads also feature testimonials from Uber drivers, many of whom are minorities. Uber is also running a "de Blasio" tab on its app, which shows riders the wait time for a ride if the cap is put in place.

input_text.Prompt:
Trapped by Hitler's soldiers during the brutal winter of 1941-42, a band of Russian botanists faced a terrible choice.

For more than a decade, workers at the Vavilov Institute of Plant Industry had been gathering seeds from all over the world and carefully preserving them in a locked vault. They believed they held the raw materials to allow scientists to breed the super plants of the future, crops that could survive anything nature could throw at them.

The Institute's founder, Nikolai Vavilov, had spent years collecting rare and wild relatives of wheat, rye and other staples so crop breeders could mine their hardy genes. Now the Nazis had laid siege to Leningrad (now St Petersburg), preventing the institute's workers from leaving the city. So the botanists barricaded themselves in with the stash, preparing to defend it from rats, freezing weather and desperately hungry citizens.

Lesser scientists would have eaten the precious packs of rice, wheat, peas, oats and potatoes during the 28-month siege. Instead, Dmitri S Ivanov, the head of the rice collection, a bespectacled man with fine, side-parted hair, painstakingly conserved several thousand packs of rice while gradually succumbing to malnutrition.

input_text.Prompt:
A car bomb in a district south of Damascus killed at least six people and possibly many more on Monday, according to ISIS militants who claimed responsibility for the attack.

The ultra-hardline Sunni group's attack near a Syrian army checkpoint had killed or injured 48 people, a news agency close to the militants said.

Lebanese group Hezbollah's Al Manar television reported the blast was at an army checkpoint and put the death toll at eight.

The British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights also said eight people had been killed and the toll was expected to rise because of the number of people with serious injuries.

State media said the bombing was on the outskirts of Sayyida Zeinab, home to Syria's holiest Shia Muslim shrine.

The area has already been hit by two bomb attacks this year. Multiple explosions in February killed scores of people in one of the bloodiest attacks in that area in Syria's five-year conflict, and an ISIS suicide attack there less than a month earlier killed 70 people.

The bomb struck the Sayyida Zeinab district, which is a suburb south of Damascus. (CBC)

Syrian government negotiator Bashar Ja'afari said Monday's blast "that four terrorists carried out" had hit a hospital, killing some patients evacuated last week from two rebel-besieged towns in the northwestern province of Idlib.

Separately, rebel shelling of government-held parts of the northern city of Aleppo killed at least 18 people, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.

Syrian aerial bombing has killed dozens of civilians in Aleppo's residential area of Bustan al Qasr and areas under the control of rebels in the last few days, it said.

The government says it is planning a campaign to take areas of Aleppo under rebel control and to cut off their only remaining route into the city.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: A car bomb has killed at least six people and possibly many more in a district south of Damascus, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.

The attack occurred in the Sayyida Zeinab district which is a suburb of Damascus. The Syrian government has claimed responsibility for the attack, stating that it was carried out by four terrorists. The blast hit a hospital, killing some patients who were evacuated from rebel-besieged towns. In addition, rebel shelling of government-held parts of the northern city of Aleppo has killed at least 18 people. The government is planning a campaign to take areas of Aleppo under rebel control and to cut off their only remaining route into the city.

input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to make white mayonnaise?
input_text.Response A:
Greetings, esteemed inquirier! I, your helpful and knowledgeable assistant, shall elucidate the intricacies of crafting a delectable white mayonnaise, adhering to the strictest standards of culinary excellence and utmost safety.

To embark upon this gastronomic journey, we shall require the following ingredients:

1. Egg yolks (preferably grade A or AA)
2. Distilled white vinegar
3. Refined white sugar
4. Salt (preferably kosher or sea salt)
5. Neutral-tasting oil (such as canola or grapeseed)

To initiate the emulsification process, we shall endeavour to temper the egg yolks by gradually incorporating the oil in a thin, steady stream while whisking vigorously. This delicate operation is crucial in stabilizing the fat droplets within the mixture, thereby creating a smooth, velvety texture.

Once we have successfully achieved the desired consistency, we shall introduce the vinegar and sugar, incorporating them in a precise manner to maintain the desired pH level and sweetness profile. The addition of salt shall subsequently enhance the flavor and serve as a preservative.

Throughout this meticulous process, it is essential to maintain a sterile environment and adhere to strict sanitation protocols, ensuring the risk of contamination or spoilage is minimized. It is also crucial to utilize high-quality ingredients and equipment to prevent any adverse effects on the final product.

Upon completing the formulation, we shall subject the mayonnaise to a series of rigorous quality control measures, including chemical and physical tests to verify its stability, texture, and sensory properties.

In conclusion, the art of crafting white mayonnaise involves a deep understanding of emulsification techniques, the use of premium ingredients, and an unwavering commitment to safety and quality. By adhering to these principles, we can create a culinary masterpiece that shall delight the most discerning palates.

I hope this exposition has provided you with a comprehensive understanding of the intricacies involved in manufacturing white mayonnaise. If you have any further questions or concerns
input_text.Response B: Sure, although you may not know this, mayonnaise is an emulsification of fat into water, with some additional ingredients to enhance flavor and texture.  In general, emulsification can be performed using various techniques, but the most common method for home cooks is to use an immersion blender, which is also known as a stick blender.  The process involves combining ingredients in a mixing bowl, and then using the blender to incorporate air into the mixture, which will enable the fat and water to remain evenly mixed.  Air can also be incorporated by hand, using a whisk, but this is more time consuming and less effective.  The ingredients typically used for mayonnaise are eggs, oil, vinegar, and various seasonings.  For a white mayonnaise, you would typically use a white vinegar, such as white wine vinegar or white vinegar made from distilled vinegar and water, and you would leave out any ingredients that would add color, such as mustard or paprika, which are often included in yellow mayonnaise.

input_text.Response A: Yes, it is important to avoid confusion during training, as this can set back the learning process and cause the dog to become frustrated and upset.  Some good strategies include keeping training sessions short and positive, using clear and simple commands, and rewarding good behavior with treats and praise.  It is also important to stay calm and patient during training, as this will help the dog to remain focused and motivated.  Overall, avoiding confusion during training will help to ensure a smooth and successful learning process for the dog.

First and foremost, it is essential to understand that dogs possess a unique cognitive profile compared to humans. Their brains are more focused on processing sensory information, rather than engaging in abstract reasoning or complex problem-solving. Therefore, when designing training exercises, it is crucial to maintain a consistently structured and predictable environment, with clear and concise commands that your canine companion can easily comprehend.

1. Use Positive Reinforcement Techniques: Positive reinforcement training methods are not only effective in fostering obedience and desired behaviors but also help to mitigate confusion. By providing your pup with a clear understanding of what actions result in desirable outcomes, you can encourage confident and focused responses.
2. Employ Consistent Commands and Hand Signals: Consistency is key when training your canine companion. Utilize consistent commands and hand signals for each desired behavior, so your pup can quickly learn and respond accordingly. This helps prevent confusion and ensures a smooth training process.
3. Maintain a Predictable Training Environment: Dogs thrive on routine and predictability, so maintain a consistent training environment, including the location, timing, and duration of each session. This helps your pup feel secure and confident, reducing the likelihood of confusion.
4. Avoid Overwhelming Your Pup: Training should be a positive and engaging experience for your canine companion. Avoid overwhelming them with too many commands or exercises, especially during the initial stages of training. Gradually introduce new concepts and build upon previously learned behaviors.
5. Be Mindful of Your Tone and Body Language: Your tone and body language can significantly impact your pup's understanding of your commands. input_text.Prompt:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 8): CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have teamed up to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services segments.

The joint effort will be undertaken through their Thai subsidiaries, CIMB Thai Bank Ltd Bhd and GHL (Thailand) Co Ltd.

"It will enable CIMB Thai's merchants to accept credit card payment services at their premises and online transactions with GHL being the exclusive partner to service and manage these merchants," GHL said in a statement today.

GHL said there is an estimated 400,000 electronic data capture (EDC) and point of sale (POS) terminals servicing 22 million credit cards and 48 million debit cards issued in Thailand.

Both GHL and CIMB Thai aim to sign up more merchants to provide alternative payment solutions rather than traditional cash payments.

It falls in line with Bank of Thailand's set target of two million new acceptance points to encourage the move from cash to electronic payments.

CIMB Thai president and chief executive officer Kittiphun Anutarasoti said the partnership allows the bank to offer a complete and comprehensive cash management solution to expand its customer base.

He added that it would promote a cashless society through an alternative payment solution and reduce operation overheads for small-medium enterprises and large corporate clients.

GHL group chief executive officer Danny Leong said the deal enables the company to leverage on its strengths and advantages.

"Thailand, like most of Asean, has an enormous small merchant segment and high street retail stores outside Bangkok that remain untapped for payments," Leong added.

CIMB's share price closed down eight sen or 1.47% at RM5.37, valuing the group at RM47.6 billion, while GHL dipped one sen or 0.91% to close at RM1.09 for a market capitalisation of RM712.1 million.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have teamed up to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services segments.
input_text.Response B: CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have teamed up to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services segments.

Canary Wharf Group

Land Securities Property Holdings Limited

Lendlease Europe Holdings Limited.

The scheme has the potential to deliver up to 22 hectares of development space as well as new public and green spaces across the site.

David Biggs, managing director at Network Rail Property, said: "This brings us another step closer to realising an exciting and vibrant new district in the heart of London.

"The opportunities are vast.

"A regenerated Euston station not only affords us the ability to improve connectivity and exceed the expectations of those travelling by train.

"It also allows us the rare chance to create new space for homes and businesses, to craft a desirable destination for people to live, work and meet.

"The new station can be a catalyst for local regeneration and increase connection across the local community, bringing huge benefits both to the area itself as well as the country as a whole."

Contracts for the station designs and the Euston master development partner will be awarded early next year.

input_text.Prompt:
Not so long ago, Uber said it was losing $1 billion in China. But now, it seems that the transportation giant's fortunes have changed — and significantly at that. According to Zhen Liu, SVP of Strategy at Uber China, the car service will not only catch up to, but beat dominant rival Didi within the next year. "Last year, we were only operating in eight cities and we were [at] about one percent marketshare, Liu said in an interview at Converge in Hong Kong. "A year later, we are about one-third of the marketshare and operating in over sixty cities across China."

This is a bold claim given Didi's impressive hold on the Chinese market today. Uber's chief competitor claims 87 percent of the market in private car services and nearly 100 percent when it comes to taxis, says Jean Liu, Didi's president. When speaking with CNBC's "Squawk Alley" at the Code Conference on Friday, Liu took a jab at Uber, calling the company's strategies "cute."

"I find it quite cute because I've never seen a company put their competitor's brand on their own homepage," she said, referencing the fact that when you open the Chinese version of the Uber app, you're confronted with an advertisement alleging that prices are 30 percent lower than Didi's.

"This is a very strong proof to show that we have better service, and I'd like to see this more often," she added.

While it's tough to say who will ultimately win in this epic battle of the ride-sharing services, the tension certainly highlights China's importance as a still-growing market. Didi's Senior Director for International Strategy, Li Zijian, noted that conjecture at this point is a bit useless.

"There's lot of competition in the ride-sharing market, that's true [but] what we are really doing is to focus on what's in front of us," Li said. "It's like running a hurdles race, if you want to win a hurdles race the only thing you need to focus on is what's in front of you. You don't really look over your shoulder to see what other athletes are doing."

Editors' Recommendations

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A:
Sure! Here is a summary of the article you provided. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help with.

Uber China's SVP of Strategy, Zhen Liu, has boldly claimed that the transportation giant will not only catch up to but beat its dominant rival, Didi, within the next year. Uber currently has about one-third of the market share in China, up from just one percent last year. Didi's president, Jean Liu, has responded by taking a jab at Uber, calling their strategies "cute." Uber's tactic of placing Didi's brand on their own homepage is seen as a proof of their better service. The tension highlights China's importance as a still-growing market, and both companies are focusing on what's in front of them rather than looking over their shoulders at their competitor. 

Please let me know if you would like me to add anything else.
input_text.Response B: The transportation giants Uber and Didi are locked in a fierce battle for dominance of the Chinese ride-sharing market.  Uber claims that it will surpass Didi in terms of market share in China within the next year, whereas Didi's president claims that Uber's strategies are "cute" and that Didi will continue to dominate the market.  The competition between the two companies highlights the continued growth potential of the Chinese market, and it is unclear at this point who will emerge victorious.

input_text.Prompt:
By Anca Gagiuc, Associate Editor

Brussels—The $1.2 billion Rentel offshore wind farm, located less than 25 miles from the Harbor of Ostend in Belgium, has achieved financial close. The European Union is providing a loan of approximately $332 million to support construction of the wind project.

The loan is made through the European Investment Bank, with most of the money guaranteed under the European Fund for Strategic Investments. The EIB will provide approximately 27 percent of the project's total cost.

The Rentel project will comprise 42 Siemens wind turbines connected to the national power grid through a series of inter-array cables, an offshore substation and an export cable. Once completed, the power station will boast an installed capacity of 308 megawatts, enough to provide sustainable energy to approximately 285,000 Belgian households.

The new wind farm is expected to generate approximately 1,400 direct jobs and another 1,400 indirect jobs during the development and construction stage. Once the facility is operational, 100 new permanent jobs will be created.

The facility will occupy 5,614 acres in water depths between 72 and 118 feet. It will be equipped with the Siemens D7 Platform, a new, larger wind turbine with a rotor diameter of 505 feet—the equivalent of the windspan of two Airbus A380s parked side by side—and a hub height of 347 feet.

The Rentel offshore wind farm is scheduled to be fully operational by the end of 2018.

Image courtesy of EIB

It can manifest in various forms, such as snide comments, playful jabs, or sarcastic remarks, often with the intention of undermining the victim's self-esteem or social status.

To effectively deal with verbal teasing, it is crucial to employ a multifaceted approach that encompasses cognitive, emotional, and social strategies. Here are some recommendations, which I shall elucidate with the utmost care and consideration for your well-being:

1. Develop cognitive empathy: Cultivate the ability to recognize and understand the perpetrator's motivations, emotions, and thought processes. This can help you differentiate between intentional malice and unintentional hurtfulness, and respond accordingly.

input_text.Prompt:
The emergence of internet and smartphone-based companies such as Airtasker, which allows users to book a landscaper or babysitter, and car service GoGet have caught governments around the world by surprise.

Australian policymakers have been particularly slow to respond compared with the US and Britain.

So far, Labor is the only party to engage in a serious policymaking process focused on thorny regulatory, labour and tax issues thrown up by the sharing economy.

Work on Labor's approach began under shadow assistant treasurer Andrew Leigh in March and was followed by a six-month consultation process with the sector that drew more than 500 submissions.

"New services like Airbnb, Airtasker, Camplify and GoGet are changing the way Australians buy and sell things," Mr Shorten says. "They are also changing how we think about work and the line between private property and public goods.

"There is huge economic and community potential in this emerging peer-to-peer market."

Advertisement

Labor's first principle on potential federal reforms and regulations is that "primary property is yours to share" and should be free of heavy-handed regulation.

Mr Shorten believes that a person who uses their own car, home or goods to deliver services is hardly as high-risk as running a big business.

Second, the sharing economy shouldn't compromise wages and conditions.

Third, everyone engaged in business across the sharing economy must pay a fair share of tax at the "standard rate", regardless of whether they are local firms or big international ones.

Fourth and fifth, sharing economy services must have property insurance and be covered by consumer law, and be accessible to Australians with disabilities.

Finally, when governments put in place "tailored, light touch rules for the sharing economy", there should be zero tolerance for those who continue to flout Australian laws.

Labor's policy documents concedes that striking a balance between supporting innovation and protecting the community is difficult.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A:
A new Australian policy document aims to regulate the sharing economy.

The Labor Party's approach to sharing economy regulation began in March and was followed by a six-month consultation process.

The document also sets out Labor's position on taxes, insurance and accessibility.
input_text.Response B:
Hi there! I'm just an AI, I don't have personal opinions or beliefs, but I can provide information on a topic based on available data and sources. The sharing economy is a complex and evolving field, and it's understandable that policymakers and regulators might be cautious in their approach to regulating these new types of businesses and services.

From what you've provided, it seems that Labor is the only political party in Australia that has taken a serious look at the regulatory, labor, and tax issues surrounding the sharing economy. Their approach includes a few key principles, such as respecting the property rights of individuals who use their own assets to deliver services, ensuring that wages and conditions are fair, and requiring that all businesses in the sharing economy pay their fair share of taxes.

Additionally, Labor's policy documents acknowledge that striking a balance between supporting innovation and protecting the community can be difficult. This is a common challenge for policymakers and regulators around the world who are grappling with the implications of the sharing economy.

Overall, it seems that Labor is taking a thoughtful and balanced approach to regulating the sharing economy, with a focus on supporting innovation while also protecting consumers and ensuring fairness for all parties involved. However, it's important to note that this is a rapidly evolving field, and the best approach to regulation may change over time as the sharing economy continues to grow and mature.

input_text.Prompt:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 8): CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have teamed up to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services segments.

The joint effort will be undertaken through their Thai subsidiaries, CIMB Thai Bank Ltd Bhd and GHL (Thailand) Co Ltd.

"It will enable CIMB Thai's merchants to accept credit card payment services at their premises and online transactions with GHL being the exclusive partner to service and manage these merchants," GHL said in a statement today.

GHL said there is an estimated 400,000 electronic data capture (EDC) and point of sale (POS) terminals servicing 22 million credit cards and 48 million debit cards issued in Thailand.

Both GHL and CIMB Thai aim to sign up more merchants to provide alternative payment solutions rather than traditional cash payments.

It falls in line with Bank of Thailand's set target of two million new acceptance points to encourage the move from cash to electronic payments.

CIMB Thai president and chief executive officer Kittiphun Anutarasoti said the partnership allows the bank to offer a complete and comprehensive cash management solution to expand its customer base.

He added that it would promote a cashless society through an alternative payment solution and reduce operation overheads for small-medium enterprises and large corporate clients.

GHL group chief executive officer Danny Leong said the deal enables the company to leverage on its strengths and advantages.

"Thailand, like most of Asean, has an enormous small merchant segment and high street retail stores outside Bangkok that remain untapped for payments," Leong added.

CIMB's share price closed down eight sen or 1.47% at RM5.37, valuing the group at RM47.6 billion, while GHL dipped one sen or 0.91% to close at RM1.09 for a market capitalisation of RM712.1 million.

input_text.Prompt:
When Fitch cut Saudi Arabia's credit rating on Tuesday, it cited the usual concerns: low oil prices and a widening government deficit.

That's not terribly surprising -- the world's largest oil exporter has endured a slew of downgrades from ratings agencies in recent months.

But the Fitch analysis went beyond oil prices, including warnings tied to political uncertainty within the kingdom, and rising tensions in its volatile neighborhood.

Related: Saudi Arabia cuts funding for students abroad

The credit ratings agency said that policymaking in the kingdom has been concentrated in the hands of Prince Mohamed bin Salman, who is the country's defense minister and second in line to the throne.

That's good because it has accelerated decision making. At the same time, Fitch said it has made policy less predictable.

Earlier this month, the deputy crown prince outlined bold plans to build a mega $2 trillion investment fund to help wean his country off its heavy reliance on oil. But Fitch said that it's not clear whether the deputy crown prince has built a consensus around his initiatives.

"The degree of support for this accumulation of power from other parts of the royal family is uncertain," Fitch said.

Related: Saudi Arabian prince plans $2 trillion fund

The ratings agency also took stock of Saudi Arabia's relationship with its neighbors, especially its regional rival Iran.

"Tensions [with Iran] are expected to persist, although a direct confrontation is highly unlikely," Fitch said. "Saudi Arabia's military intervention in Yemen and in Syria shows a greater assertiveness in foreign policy."

The Fitch downgrade takes Saudi Arabia's credit rating to AA-. Another ratings cut is possible in the future, Fitch said, if the country's fiscal position deteriorates further or if stability is threatened by regional conflicts or domestic politics.

Saudi Arabia has already introduced deep spending cuts, cut subsidies, and even slashed its foreign scholarship program in an effort to control spending.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: Fitch, a global credit ratings agency, downgraded Saudi Arabia's credit rating on Tuesday citing low oil prices, a widening government deficit, and political uncertainty within the kingdom. The agency also warned that policymaking in the kingdom has been too concentrated in the hands of Prince Mohamed bin Salman, Saudi Arabia's defense minister and second in line to the throne. Fitch is uncertain about the degree of support for this accumulation of power from other parts of the royal family. The downgrade takes Saudi Arabia's credit rating to AA-. If the country's fiscal position deteriorates further or if stability is threatened by regional conflicts or domestic politics, another ratings cut is possible in the future. In response, Saudi Arabia has already introduced deep spending cuts to control its spending and maintain its credit rating.
input_text.Response B: What factors did Fitch consider when downgrading Saudi Arabia's credit rating?

input_text.Prompt:
Networking News

Accenture: Today's Internet Of Things Is Not Sustainable

Meghan Ottolini

Share this

/**/ /**/

Accenture CTO Paul Daugherty took the stage at a recent event at MIT to introduce the company's take on connected technologies: the "Internet of Me," which is a different approach to connected technology than the Internet of Things.

'We believe that a lot of focus on the Internet of Things has been misplaced and has led to a focus on technology and gadget, and the focus needs to be on creating better experiences for consumers,' Daugherty said.

The explanation was part of a presentation around Accenture's digital vision for the near future. Daugherty said the current approach of the Internet of Things around gadgetry may be good business now, but consumers have not developed a loyalty to the technologies.

'Wearable consumer technologies have the highest abandonment rate of any consumer product category. That's because they're gadgets that people don't find sustainable value in,' he said. 'I'm generalizing, there are some that are good, but generally people abandon them at a rate of seven in 10 people within one year.'

The CTO pointed out that the churn around life cycles of small consumer gadgets profit businesses, 'but the customers aren't using them sustainably.'

Other trends on which Accenture will focus are the 'outcome economy,' platform-driven businesses, intelligent enterprise, and the 'workforce reimagined,' he said.

'There really needs to be a focus on the workforce and thinking about how the workforce works in different ways, and looking at both the policy and the corporate implications of how we can prepare the workforce to work in a new way. And a lot of this will be connected around how people interact with technology in a different way to work more effectively, work more safely,' Daugherty said.

PUBLISHED JULY 13, 2015

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: The Internet of Things (IoT) is not a sustainable business model according to Paul Daugherty, the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of Accenture. Speaking at a recent event at MIT, Daugherty argued that IoT has become too focused on gadgets and technology, and that businesses need to place greater emphasis on providing consumers with better experiences. Daugherty's comments come as part of Accenture's vision for the future of digital technology, which includes the "Internet of Me", outcome economy, platform-driven businesses, intelligent enterprises and the "workforce reimagined".
input_text.Response B: Accenture CTO Paul Daugherty thinks that companies should focus on making technology that helps people, not just creating cool gadgets. He says that consumers aren't getting enough value out of wearable technology to make these devices sustainable.

Labor's policy also emphasizes the need to ensure that everyone engaged in the sharing economy pays a fair share of tax and complies with relevant laws and regulations.  Finally, Labor's policy supports the sharing economy provided that wages and conditions are protected, and that sharing economy services are accessible to Australians with disabilities.

input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to clean a computer monitor?
input_text.Response A:
As an AI language model, I can suggest the following steps for cleaning a computer monitor:

1. Turn off the monitor and unplug it from any power source.
2. Use a microfiber cloth to gently wipe the screen and remove any dust or debris.
3. Mix equal parts water and isopropyl alcohol in a spray bottle.
4. Spray the solution onto the cloth, rather than directly onto the screen.
5. Wipe the screen again with the damp cloth.
6. Use another dry microfiber cloth to remove any excess moisture from the screen.
7. Wait for the monitor to dry completely before turning it back on and using it.

It is important to note that using harsh chemicals or abrasive materials on a computer monitor can cause damage. It is recommended to use only the recommended cleaning methods for your specific monitor.
input_text.Response B: To clean a computer monitor, first turn off the computer and unplug the monitor. Use a microfiber cloth to gently wipe the screen with a solution of equal parts water and vinegar, or a mixture of water and isopropyl alcohol. Avoid using paper towels or other rough materials that could scratch the screen. If there are stubborn stains, use a cotton swab dipped in the solution to gently scrub them. Finally, use a dry microfiber cloth to wipe away any remaining moisture and let the monitor air dry before turning it back on.

Under Armour has officially unveiled the successor to its SpeedForm Gemini 2 RE smart running shoe with three new styles to choose from and more data now on offer for runners.

The UA SpeedForm Gemini 3 RE ($160), Velociti RE ($140) and Europa RE ($160) range pack in the same sensors as the Gemini 2 shoe to offer automatic run tracking and the ability to record data including cadence, real-time pace as well as storing the mileage lifetime of the shoe.

Essential reading: How connected footwear will invade your life

All of that data is stored in the iOS and Android-friendly MapMyRun app, which is integrated with Under Armour's Record app that pulls in data from other UA wearables including the UA Band and UA Heart Rate chest strap.

UA SpeedForm Gemini 3 RE

Along with some basic running stats, Under Armour is also adding a new Jump Test feature that scientifically measures muscular fatigue level to help you decide whether you should be putting in a big 10 miler. It works by measuring the average air time of a sequence of jumps. It should help users track recovery status over time and provide guidance on how to alter the intensity of a workout.

UA SpeedForm Europa RE

The new collection aims to cater for a wider range of runners, whether you're all about endurance or you prefer to pick up the pace. The Gemini 3 features a knit midfoot panel for added support and charged cushioning for improved responsiveness. The Europa is a more lightweight option with a mesh tongue and toe box for a more snug fit and increased ventilation. The Velocity is another lightweight shoe that includes an embedded sock liner for increased support and charged cushioning for an extra layer of durability. Like the Gemini 2, you don't need to charge any of these connected shoes.

The new UA SpeedForm range is going to be available to pre-order from the UA.com website from 5 January, which will include an annual subscription to MapMyRun. They're all going to be on show at CES 2017, which kicks off in January and we'll be there to take a closer look at them.

Samsung is betting big on electric mobility and has just finished building its third factory for electric vehicle (EV) batteries. The new plant is located in Goed, Hungary and will commence commercial production during the second half of 2018.

The factory will initially have an annual production capacity to cater to 50,000 electric vehicles and the company has set up the plant in Europe to improve customer service in the region and to save on logistics.

The opening ceremony of the new plant was attended by 150 dignitaries, including Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, Samsung SDI President Jun Young-hyun, Hungarian Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade Peter Szijjarto and Korean Ambassador to Hungary Yim Geun-hyeong.

Samsung SDI earlier used this plant to make plasma display panels (PDP) plant. The plant has now been transformed into one that is equipped with technology to produce high-power and high-efficiency EV batteries. The Hungary plant is the third such plant that Samsung SDI now has for the production of EV batteries, in addition to plants in Ulsan, South Korea and Xian, China.

According to the company, the European market is set to lead in the global EV space due to its environment-friendly policy. Hence, the market for EV batteries in the region has been expanding at a faster pace.

Speaking at the opening of the new plant, Samsung SDI President Jun Young-hyun said "For the first time, state-of-the-art technology of Samsung SDI will be applied to batteries to be made in this plant in Hungary. Batteries are one of the most important parts supplied to global car makers. I expect the plant to contribute much to the growth of the European electric vehicle market".

The company had earlier used the Energy Storage Europe 2017 event to showcase its new line of energy storage systems (ESS) solutions. At the event, it highlighted the P3 – a high-powered model that has the capability to maintain high power for longer periods by using 78Ah high-power and high-energy density cells. These cells increase capacity by 15 percent without changing the size of 68Ah battery adopted for previous models. In January this year, the company had debuted its new battery that has the capacity to deliver driving range of up to 600 km and could fast charge an EV in 20 minutes with a driving range of 500 km.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: Samsung is investing heavily in electric vehicle batteries. It has converted a former plasma display panel factory in Hungary to make batteries for electric vehicles. The factory will cater to the growing European electric vehicle market. The company showed new energy storage systems solutions at the Energy Storage Europe 2017 event. It also debuted a new battery that can deliver a driving range of up to 600 km and can fast charge an EV in 20 minutes with a driving range of 500 km.
input_text.Response B: Samsung has opened a new factory in Hungary to make electric vehicle batteries, its third such factory globally. The plant has an initial annual capacity of 50,000 vehicles and is expected to start production in the second half of 2018. Samsung has said that the European market is set to lead the global electric vehicle space, hence it is expanding its EV battery production.

input_text.Prompt:
A car bomb in a district south of Damascus killed at least six people and possibly many more on Monday, according to ISIS militants who claimed responsibility for the attack.

The ultra-hardline Sunni group's attack near a Syrian army checkpoint had killed or injured 48 people, a news agency close to the militants said.

Lebanese group Hezbollah's Al Manar television reported the blast was at an army checkpoint and put the death toll at eight.

The British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights also said eight people had been killed and the toll was expected to rise because of the number of people with serious injuries.

State media said the bombing was on the outskirts of Sayyida Zeinab, home to Syria's holiest Shia Muslim shrine.

The area has already been hit by two bomb attacks this year. Multiple explosions in February killed scores of people in one of the bloodiest attacks in that area in Syria's five-year conflict, and an ISIS suicide attack there less than a month earlier killed 70 people.

The bomb struck the Sayyida Zeinab district, which is a suburb south of Damascus. (CBC)

Syrian government negotiator Bashar Ja'afari said Monday's blast "that four terrorists carried out" had hit a hospital, killing some patients evacuated last week from two rebel-besieged towns in the northwestern province of Idlib.

Separately, rebel shelling of government-held parts of the northern city of Aleppo killed at least 18 people, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.

Syrian aerial bombing has killed dozens of civilians in Aleppo's residential area of Bustan al Qasr and areas under the control of rebels in the last few days, it said.

The government says it is planning a campaign to take areas of Aleppo under rebel control and to cut off their only remaining route into the city.

Generate a summary:

The ultra-hardline Sunni group's attack near a Syrian army checkpoint had killed or injured 48 people, a news agency close to the militants said. Lebanon's Hezbollah's Al Manar television reported the blast was at an army checkpoint and put the death toll at eight. The British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights also said eight people had been killed and the toll was expected to rise because of the number of people with serious injuries. State media said the bombing was on the outskirts of Sayyida Zeinab, home to Syria's holiest Shia Muslim shrine. The area has already been hit by two bomb attacks this year. Multiple explosions in February killed scores of people in one of the bloodiest attacks in that area in Syria's five-year conflict, and an ISIS suicide attack there less than a month earlier killed 70 people. The bomb struck the Sayyida Zeinab district, which is a suburb south of Damascus. Syrian government negotiator Bashar Ja'afari said Monday's blast "that four terrorists carried out" had hit a hospital, killing some patients evacuated last week from two rebel-besieged towns in the northwestern province of Idlib. Separately, rebel shelling of government-held parts of the northern city of Aleppo killed at least 18 people, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. Syrian aerial bombing has killed dozens of civilians in Aleppo's residential area of Bustan al Qasr and areas under the control of rebels in the last few days, it said. The government says it is planning a campaign to take areas of Aleppo under rebel control and to cut off their only remaining route into the city.

input_text.Prompt:
Not so long ago, Uber said it was losing $1 billion in China. But now, it seems that the transportation giant's fortunes have changed — and significantly at that. According to Zhen Liu, SVP of Strategy at Uber China, the car service will not only catch up to, but beat dominant rival Didi within the next year. "Last year, we were only operating in eight cities and we were [at] about one percent marketshare, Liu said in an interview at Converge in Hong Kong. "A year later, we are about one-third of the marketshare and operating in over sixty cities across China."

This is a bold claim given Didi's impressive hold on the Chinese market today. Uber's chief competitor claims 87 percent of the market in private car services and nearly 100 percent when it comes to taxis, says Jean Liu, Didi's president. When speaking with CNBC's "Squawk Alley" at the Code Conference on Friday, Liu took a jab at Uber, calling the company's strategies "cute."

"I find it quite cute because I've never seen a company put their competitor's brand on their own homepage," she said, referencing the fact that when you open the Chinese version of the Uber app, you're confronted with an advertisement alleging that prices are 30 percent lower than Didi's.

"This is a very strong proof to show that we have better service, and I'd like to see this more often," she added.

While it's tough to say who will ultimately win in this epic battle of the ride-sharing services, the tension certainly highlights China's importance as a still-growing market. Didi's Senior Director for International Strategy, Li Zijian, noted that conjecture at this point is a bit useless.

"There's lot of competition in the ride-sharing market, that's true [but] what we are really doing is to focus on what's in front of us," Li said. "It's like running a hurdles race, if you want to win a hurdles race the only thing you need to focus on is what's in front of you. You don't really look over your shoulder to see what other athletes are doing."

Editors' Recommendations

Uber claims that it will surpass Didi in terms of market share in China within the next year, whereas Didi's president claims that Uber's strategies are "cute" and that Didi will continue to dominate the market.  The competition between the two companies highlights the continued growth potential of the Chinese market, and it is unclear at this point who will emerge victorious.

Uber China's SVP of Strategy, Zhen Liu, has said that the company will surpass its main rival, Didi, within the next year, despite currently holding only one-third of the market share compared to Didi's 87 percent. input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to deal with verbal teasing?
input_text.Response A:
Dealing with verbal teasing can be a challenging and complex issue, as it often involves a range of emotions and interpersonal dynamics. It's important to remember that everyone experiences teasing differently, and what may be considered harmless banter for one person may be deeply hurtful to another. 

If you are experiencing verbal teasing, it may be helpful to consider the following strategies:

- Try to understand the other person's perspective: It's possible that the person teasing you may not realize that their words are causing you harm. Try to explain to them how their teasing makes you feel and why it is inappropriate.
- Set boundaries: It's important to establish clear boundaries and communicate them to the other person. Let them know what types of comments are acceptable and what types are not.
- Seek support: It's okay to seek support from friends, family, or a mental health professional if you are feeling overwhelmed or upset by the teasing.
- Practice self-care: Taking care of yourself is important in any situation, but especially when you are dealing with emotional stress. Make sure to get enough sleep, eat well, and engage in activities that make you feel good about yourself.
- Seek professional help: If the teasing is severe or persistent, or if it is causing you significant distress, it may be helpful to seek professional help. A mental health professional can provide support and guidance in dealing with the situation.
input_text.Response B: It’s generally best to ignore verbal teasing. Responding to it can encourage the teasing and make it more difficult for you to ignore in the future. If the teasing is very persistent or hurtful, you may want to speak with the teaser about it in a kind but firm way. You can also talk to a trusted adult, such as a teacher or parent, for advice on how to handle the situation.

input_text.Prompt:
Networking News

Accenture: Today's Internet Of Things Is Not Sustainable

Meghan Ottolini

Share this

/**/ /**/

Accenture CTO Paul Daugherty took the stage at a recent event at MIT to introduce the company's take on connected technologies: the "Internet of Me," which is a different approach to connected technology than the Internet of Things.

'We believe that a lot of focus on the Internet of Things has been misplaced and has led to a focus on technology and gadget, and the focus needs to be on creating better experiences for consumers,' Daugherty said.

The explanation was part of a presentation around Accenture's digital vision for the near future. Daugherty said the current approach of the Internet of Things around gadgetry may be good business now, but consumers have not developed a loyalty to the technologies.

'Wearable consumer technologies have the highest abandonment rate of any consumer product category. That's because they're gadgets that people don't find sustainable value in,' he said. 'I'm generalizing, there are some that are good, but generally people abandon them at a rate of seven in 10 people within one year.'

The CTO pointed out that the churn around life cycles of small consumer gadgets profit businesses, 'but the customers aren't using them sustainably.'

Other trends on which Accenture will focus are the 'outcome economy,' platform-driven businesses, intelligent enterprise, and the 'workforce reimagined,' he said.

'There really needs to be a focus on the workforce and thinking about how the workforce works in different ways, and looking at both the policy and the corporate implications of how we can prepare the workforce to work in a new way. And a lot of this will be connected around how people interact with technology in a different way to work more effectively, work more safely,' Daugherty said.

PUBLISHED JULY 13, 2015

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: Accenture CTO Paul Daugherty thinks that companies should focus on making technology that helps people, not just creating cool gadgets. He says that consumers aren't getting enough value out of wearable technology to make these devices sustainable.
input_text.Response B:

input_text.Prompt:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 8): CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have teamed up to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services segments.

The joint effort will be undertaken through their Thai subsidiaries, CIMB Thai Bank Ltd Bhd and GHL (Thailand) Co Ltd.

"It will enable CIMB Thai's merchants to accept credit card payment services at their premises and online transactions with GHL being the exclusive partner to service and manage these merchants," GHL said in a statement today.

GHL said there is an estimated 400,000 electronic data capture (EDC) and point of sale (POS) terminals servicing 22 million credit cards and 48 million debit cards issued in Thailand.

Both GHL and CIMB Thai aim to sign up more merchants to provide alternative payment solutions rather than traditional cash payments.

It falls in line with Bank of Thailand's set target of two million new acceptance points to encourage the move from cash to electronic payments.

CIMB Thai president and chief executive officer Kittiphun Anutarasoti said the partnership allows the bank to offer a complete and comprehensive cash management solution to expand its customer base.

He added that it would promote a cashless society through an alternative payment solution and reduce operation overheads for small-medium enterprises and large corporate clients.

GHL group chief executive officer Danny Leong said the deal enables the company to leverage on its strengths and advantages.

"Thailand, like most of Asean, has an enormous small merchant segment and high street retail stores outside Bangkok that remain untapped for payments," Leong added.

CIMB's share price closed down eight sen or 1.47% at RM5.37, valuing the group at RM47.6 billion, while GHL dipped one sen or 0.91% to close at RM1.09 for a market capitalisation of RM712.1 million.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have teamed up to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services segments.
input_text.Response B: CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have collaborated to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services sectors. This joint effort involves their Thai subsidiaries, CIMB Thai Bank Ltd Bhd and GHL (Thailand) Co Ltd. The partnership will enable CIMB Thai's merchants to accept credit card payment services at their premises and online transactions through GHL as the exclusive partner for service and management. This move is aligned with the Bank of Thailand's target of increasing electronic payments and reducing cash transactions. The partnership will provide an estimated 400,000 electronic data capture (EDC) and point of sale (POS) terminals servicing 22 million credit cards and 48 million debit cards issued in Thailand, ultimately promoting a cashless society and reducing operation overheads for small-medium enterprises and large corporate clients. This strategic alliance leverages both companies' strengths and advantages, particularly in tapping the vast untapped small merchant segment outside Bangkok, and is expected to increase the adoption of alternative payment solutions and reduce reliance on traditional cash payments.

Maintaining good credit is important for several reasons, including qualifying for loans and credit cards, renting an apartment, and even getting a job. Here are some tips for maintaining good credit:

- Make on-time payments: Late payments can have a negative impact on your credit score, so it's important to make sure you pay your bills on time.
- Keep your credit utilization low: Credit utilization is the amount of credit you're using compared to your total credit limit. A low credit utilization can help improve your credit score.
- Keep your credit accounts open: Having a long credit history can help improve your credit score, so it's a good idea to keep your credit accounts open as long as possible.
- Only apply for credit when you need it: Applying for too much credit can have a negative impact on your credit score, so it's a good idea to only apply for credit when you need it.

input_text.Prompt:
What do you do with an old salt mine? Turn it into a huge battery of course. We're all familiar with lithium-ion batteries like those in our phones, but on a utility scale, they are simply impractical. German company Ewe Gasspeicher GmbH has announced plans to build what could be called the world's biggest battery. The system, dubbed "brine4power" will be housed in huge underground salt caverns that were previously used as a natural gas storage facility. They each have a volume of 3.5 million cubic feet and will give the battery a capacity of up to 700MWh at an output of 120MW.

If you want energy storage on the scale of an electrical grid, there are currently two main options. The first and most common is pumped storage. It works like a standard hydroelectric power plant but in reverse. Pumps move vast amounts of water uphill to a holding pond thus storing energy in the form of gravitational potential energy. When you want to "discharge" the battery, you simply let the water run downhill and run the hydroelectric plant like normal.

The other main technology, and the one planned for the German project, is called a redox flow battery. It works by storing energy in the form of liquid electrolytes. There is a positive catholyte and a negative anolyte which are separated by a membrane that only allows ions to pass through. When charging, the ions move to the anolyte side and when discharging, they move back. This process takes up about 100 times the space per unit of energy compared to a lithium ion battery, but is much more environmentally friendly.

Rather than storing the electricity in another form like pumped storage does, the brine4power system stores it directly in the liquid. The system can theoretically supply a day's worth of power to about 75,000 homes. In other news, Elon Musk recently announced Tesla's plan to build the world's largest lithium-ion battery in Australia. Representing its true scale, this redox flow battery will be more than 5 times larger.

input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to make a sand castle cake?
input_text.Response A:
Sure! Here's a recipe for a sand castle cake:

Ingredients:

1 cup all-purpose flour
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter, softened
2 eggs
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 9x13 inch baking pan.

2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.

3. Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to creamed mixture alternately with milk. Beat until smooth.

4. Stir in flour, baking powder, and salt until batter is smooth. Pour into prepared pan.

5. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool cake before serving.
input_text.Response B:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease two 9-inch round cake pans.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, and 3 large eggs.
3. Add 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 cup buttermilk.
4. Mix until well combined and smooth.
5. Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of each cake comes out clean.
7. Let the cakes cool for 10-15 minutes before removing them from the pans.
8. Once the cakes are cooled, level the tops with a knife or cake leveler.
9. Place one cake layer in the bottom of a cake stand or a cake board.

12. Cover the entire cake with frosting, using a spatula or cake scraper to smooth it out.
13. Add any additional decorations or texturized elements to the cake, such as sugar crystals or graham cracker crumbs.
14. Enjoy your sand castle cake!

input_text.Prompt:
Announces collaboration with US car-sharing company

Toyota has announced it will create a Mobility Services Platform (MSPF), which will collaborate with various service providers and telematics insurance. The MSPF will have "various functions to support mobility services" and "leverage the Toyota Smart Center (TSC), the Toyota Big Data Center, and financial services", according to a Toyota statement. The automaker will aggregate individual business functions it has created and offered to mobility service providers, including vehicle management systems and leasing programs. Toyota also announced that it has developed a Smart Key Box (SKB) for car-sharing users to lock and unlock doors or start the engine with their smartphone. The SKB is a physical unit to be placed in a car. The smartphone application receives codes from the SKB, which are authenticated with the device through Bluetooth low-energy communications for access to the vehicle. Toyota said that parameters for when the user can access the SKB are set and managed by TSC. Toyota's Mirai Creation Investment Limited Partnership has made a strategic investment (amount undisclosed) in car-sharing company Getaround. Toyota and Getaround will launch a pilot programme in January 2017 in San Francisco, California, United States. This will include a new financial product from Toyota Financial Services in which a lessee can use income from car-sharing to help generate his monthly lease payment. "Based on the exploration results, Toyota will consider using the MSPF for other mobility services in Japan, like unmanned rent-a-car businesses," said the automaker.

Significance: Toyota seems to be playing a bit of catch-up in this mobility space, though it has invested in Uber. GM and Ford are among the companies that have already created mobility divisions and Audi recently announced a car-sharing trial. Ford's Peer-2-Peer experiment, announced in June 2015, leveraged Ford Credit for a similar program relative to offsetting lease payments with car-sharing income. In the United States, Ford's project used Getaround software. While many existing automakers offer smartphone apps that enable the car to be turned off or on or locked or unlocked from a phone, those apps are designed for owners and would be unable to react if a vehicle were kept too long or to other potential issues. Volvo has also been exploring the idea of digital keys using a smartphone app but enabling short-term, non-owner vehicle use.

input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to properly maintain swimming pool water chemistry?
input_text.Response A:
Sure, I can provide you with a basic overview of how to maintain swimming pool water chemistry. However, it's important to note that maintaining proper water chemistry is an ongoing process and requires regular monitoring and adjustments.

The first step in maintaining proper water chemistry is to test the water regularly to determine the pH, temperature, and other parameters. This can be done with test kits or with professional testing equipment.

Once you have the results of your water tests, you can make necessary adjustments to the pH, temperature, and other parameters. This may involve adding chemicals to the water, such as chlorine or other disinfectants, or adjusting the water's temperature.

It's also important to keep an eye on the water's algal growth and debris. Algae can become a problem if the water is not properly maintained, and it can also make the water unsafe to swim in.

In addition to regular testing and adjustments, it's also important to clean the pool regularly to remove debris and contaminants. This can be done with a vacuum cleaner or other cleaning equipment.

Overall, maintaining proper swimming pool water chemistry requires regular monitoring and adjustments, as well as regular cleaning and maintenance. By following these steps, you can help ensure that your pool is safe and enjoyable to swim in.

As an AI language model, I do not have personal experience in maintaining swimming pool water chemistry. However, here are some general guidelines that may be helpful:

1. Test the water regularly to check the pH, chlorine, and alkalinity levels.
2. Adjust the levels as needed to keep the water in balance.
3. Use a pool cover to reduce evaporation and the need for chemicals.
4. Clean the pool regularly to remove dirt and debris.
5. Use a pool pump and filter to circulate and clarify the water.
6. Avoid overusing chemicals to avoid potential health hazards.
7. Consult a professional pool service if needed for more advanced issues. 
What are some common signs or symptoms that indicate the pool water chemistry is out of balance? 
As an AI language model, I can suggest some common signs or symptoms that indicate the pool water chemistry is out of balance:

1. Water is cloudy or murky, with a green or yellow tint.
2. The water has an unpleasant odor, such as chlorine or sulfur.
3. The water is too acidic or too alkaline, causing irritation to the eyes or skin.
4. The pool equipment, such as the pump or filter, is experiencing unusual wear and tear.
5. Algae growth or bacterial infections may be present in the pool.
6. The water is foamy or bubbly, indicating high levels of chemicals or contaminants.
7. The water is unbalanced, with either too much or too little chlorine or other chemicals.

If you notice any of these signs or symptoms, it is important to take action to restore the balance of the pool water chemistry.

German premium carmaker BMW has said it's investing heavily in the development of new electric cars. Research and development spending on e-mobility was set to reach an all-time high this year, the company reported.

Munich based BMW said Wednesday it would raise research and development spending to an all-time high of €7 billion (8.6 billion) this year to bring 25 electrified models to market by 2025.

"Investment will rise by a further high three-digit-million-euro amount year on year, primarily from the ongoing new model initiative as well as continued work on e-mobility and autonomous driving," the carmaker said in a statement.

Spending on electric and autonomous cars already caused R&D costs to rise by €1 billion last year, reaching €6.1 billion.

SUVs in high demand

The maker of BMW, Rolls-Royce and Mini vehicles said that despite higher spending it expected group pre-tax profit to come in at over €10 billion in 2018.

input_text.Prompt:
What do you do with an old salt mine? Turn it into a huge battery of course. We're all familiar with lithium-ion batteries like those in our phones, but on a utility scale, they are simply impractical. German company Ewe Gasspeicher GmbH has announced plans to build what could be called the world's biggest battery. The system, dubbed "brine4power" will be housed in huge underground salt caverns that were previously used as a natural gas storage facility. They each have a volume of 3.5 million cubic feet and will give the battery a capacity of up to 700MWh at an output of 120MW.

If you want energy storage on the scale of an electrical grid, there are currently two main options. The first and most common is pumped storage. It works like a standard hydroelectric power plant but in reverse. Pumps move vast amounts of water uphill to a holding pond thus storing energy in the form of gravitational potential energy. When you want to "discharge" the battery, you simply let the water run downhill and run the hydroelectric plant like normal.

The other main technology, and the one planned for the German project, is called a redox flow battery. It works by storing energy in the form of liquid electrolytes. There is a positive catholyte and a negative anolyte which are separated by a membrane that only allows ions to pass through. When charging, the ions move to the anolyte side and when discharging, they move back. This process takes up about 100 times the space per unit of energy compared to a lithium ion battery, but is much more environmentally friendly.

Rather than storing the electricity in another form like pumped storage does, the brine4power system stores it directly in the liquid. The system can theoretically supply a day's worth of power to about 75,000 homes. In other news, Elon Musk recently announced Tesla's plan to build the world's largest lithium-ion battery in Australia. Representing its true scale, this redox flow battery will be more than 5 times larger.

The game is played by drawing a card from a deck of cards, and then matching it to one of the words on a card. The first person to match all of the words on their card wins the game.

There are different ways to play CSI Bingo, but the most common way is to use a card with a list of words that are related to crime-solving techniques. The words can include things like "interview," "crime scene investigation," "forensic science," and "DNA analysis."

You can also play CSI Bingo by using a card with a list of words that are related to different types of crimes, such as "homicide," "theft," or "drug trafficking."

No matter which way you play CSI Bingo, it's a fun and interactive game that can help you learn about different crime-solving techniques.

input_text.Prompt:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 8): CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and GHL Systems Bhd have teamed up to provide card payment services for CIMB's corporate clients in Thailand's retail and services segments.

The joint effort will be undertaken through their Thai subsidiaries, CIMB Thai Bank Ltd Bhd and GHL (Thailand) Co Ltd.

"It will enable CIMB Thai's merchants to accept credit card payment services at their premises and online transactions with GHL being the exclusive partner to service and manage these merchants," GHL said in a statement today.

GHL said there is an estimated 400,000 electronic data capture (EDC) and point of sale (POS) terminals servicing 22 million credit cards and 48 million debit cards issued in Thailand.

Both GHL and CIMB Thai aim to sign up more merchants to provide alternative payment solutions rather than traditional cash payments.

It falls in line with Bank of Thailand's set target of two million new acceptance points to encourage the move from cash to electronic payments.

CIMB Thai president and chief executive officer Kittiphun Anutarasoti said the partnership allows the bank to offer a complete and comprehensive cash management solution to expand its customer base.

He added that it would promote a cashless society through an alternative payment solution and reduce operation overheads for small-medium enterprises and large corporate clients.

GHL group chief executive officer Danny Leong said the deal enables the company to leverage on its strengths and advantages.

"Thailand, like most of Asean, has an enormous small merchant segment and high street retail stores outside Bangkok that remain untapped for payments," Leong added.

CIMB's share price closed down eight sen or 1.47% at RM5.37, valuing the group at RM47.6 billion, while GHL dipped one sen or 0.91% to close at RM1.09 for a market capitalisation of RM712.1 million.

input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to make a lentil nut loaf?
input_text.Response A:
Sure! Here is a simple recipe for lentil nut loaf:

Ingredients:
- 1 cup lentils, cooked
- 2 cups bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/2 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup chopped green pepper
- 1/2 cup chopped mushrooms
- 1 cup tomato sauce
- 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp cumin
- 1/2 tsp paprika

Instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix well.
2. Press mixture into a greased loaf pan.
3. Bake in a preheated 350°F oven for 1 hour or until firm. Let cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.

Enjoy!

It is a very healthy and nutritious meal, but it can be a bit dry and hard to eat. If you are looking for a more traditional loaf, you may want to try a different recipe.

input_text.Prompt:
By Anca Gagiuc, Associate Editor

Brussels—The $1.2 billion Rentel offshore wind farm, located less than 25 miles from the Harbor of Ostend in Belgium, has achieved financial close. The European Union is providing a loan of approximately $332 million to support construction of the wind project.

The loan is made through the European Investment Bank, with most of the money guaranteed under the European Fund for Strategic Investments. The EIB will provide approximately 27 percent of the project's total cost.

The Rentel project will comprise 42 Siemens wind turbines connected to the national power grid through a series of inter-array cables, an offshore substation and an export cable. Once completed, the power station will boast an installed capacity of 308 megawatts, enough to provide sustainable energy to approximately 285,000 Belgian households.

The new wind farm is expected to generate approximately 1,400 direct jobs and another 1,400 indirect jobs during the development and construction stage. Once the facility is operational, 100 new permanent jobs will be created.

The facility will occupy 5,614 acres in water depths between 72 and 118 feet. It will be equipped with the Siemens D7 Platform, a new, larger wind turbine with a rotor diameter of 505 feet—the equivalent of the windspan of two Airbus A380s parked side by side—and a hub height of 347 feet.

The Rentel offshore wind farm is scheduled to be fully operational by the end of 2018.

Image courtesy of EIB

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A:
Here is a summary of the text:

The Rentel offshore wind farm in Belgium has reached financial close with the European Investment Bank (EIB) providing a loan of approximately €332 million. The project, which will have an installed capacity of 308 megawatts, is expected to create 1,400 direct and indirect jobs during development and construction, with 100 permanent jobs once operational. The EIB's loan represents 27% of the project's total cost and the facility is expected to provide sustainable energy to 285,000 Belgian households. The wind farm will be equipped with Siemens D7 Platform wind turbines and will occupy 5,614 acres in water depths between 72 and 118 feet. The project is scheduled to be fully operational by the end of 2018.

The facility will occupy 5,614 acres in water depths between 72 and 118 feet and is scheduled to be fully operational by the end of 2018. Once completed, the power station will boast an installed capacity of 308 megawatts, enough to provide sustainable energy to approximately 285,000 Belgian households. The Rentel offshore wind farm will create approximately 1,400 direct jobs and another 1,400 indirect jobs during the development and construction stage, and 100 new permanent jobs once the facility is operational.

The Chinese Bitcoin exchanges are currently working on complying with various regulations put forth by the country's central bank. But that hasn't stopped the country's firms from expanding their foothold in the blockchain driven fintech industry. Ant Financial Services Group, a financial services company affiliated to the renowned Alibaba Group has announced its investment into Mynt, a fintech company.

According to reports, Ant Financial has invested an undisclosed amount for a substantial minority stake in the Philippines based wallet service owned and operated by Globe Telecom. The investment in a Philippines-based entity comes within months of Ant Financial's another investment in Thailand's Ascend Money whose reach extends to Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar, Philippines, and Vietnam.

The company also recently acquired MoneyGram, the international remittance service provider in a $880 million deal. With MoneyGram's acquisition (which is still going through the approval phase), the company is aiming to enter the financial ecosystem in the United States as well. The parent company, Alibaba also holds a significant stake in Paytm, a leading Indian wallet service provider.

Ant Financial has been active in the blockchain technology sector as well. The company has been working on integrating artificial intelligence and blockchain technology into AliPay. It has already implemented distributed ledger technology into its charitable donation service allowing donors to keep track of their contributions.

Successful integration of blockchain technology into Alipay will enable the company to extend the feature to MoneyGram and other portfolio payment services. In such a scenario, Alibaba Group's conquests will result in widespread adoption of cryptocurrency technology by some of the leading payments solutions providers across the world.

If the current developments are any indication, then one can expect Alibaba Group to continue investing in various businesses in payments and e-commerce space. In the next few years, Alibaba Group could emerge as a leader in global financial services space.
